intro: Heterodraba, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It consists of a single species, Heterodraba tetragona, which is native to the arid regions of western Australia. The plant is characterized by its unique, small, white or pale blue flowers that appear in clusters, often resembling ghostly apparitions. It has hairy, glandular leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Heterodraba is a rare and specialized plant adapted to extreme desert conditions, making it an intriguing subject for botanical study.
